content:
1. Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression: 
  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")
  1. the, press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key.
  2. When prompted, press the Reset button.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_resetting-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk

content:
If you have requests stored in separate case offline folders, perhaps done with filters, it's possible to have replies to those messages stored in the same folders, by checking the box in Account Settings, Copies & Folders, 'Place replies in the folder...'.

Other options: create a saved search (File/New...) that includes the Inbox and Sent folders. This add-on might help.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The Thunderbird email client is currently only for desktop Windows, Linux and macOS and more recently there is a mobile version for Android. There is no mobile version for iOS/iPadOS yet.

According to https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/01/video-the-thunderbird-mobile-team/ they are looking for developers.

content:
To set a background image for the message pane when no message is selected, add this to userChrome.css: 

#messagePane { background-image: url("file:///C:/Users/username/folder/imagename.jpg") !important;}


To set a background image for the message pane when a message is opened (and also the Settings tab), there is similar code for userContent.css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1441091#answer-1639485
creator: sfhowes

content:
Review the steps carefully. An important step that is often forgotten is to ensure thunderbird is not running;

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
caspermehloslawgroup said
Hello, I want to download an old version of Thunderbird (68.9 or earlier) to conduct research. I visited the following website: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/thunderbird/releases/ to download 68.9 and was met with a series of links and confusing pages with no clear "download" button. Please help me find the download link for this older version of Thunderbird, as it is imperative that I download it in order to complete my research. Please forward any links to my account email and [edited] at your earliest convenience. Thank you.

Each link is basically a folder in text form. If you are using 64-bit Windows then you will want /win64/ then you pick the folder of the language you want as there are two English options. Then download the Thunderbird Setup 68.9.0.exe

Also nobody here will be contacting you by a publicly posted email address.
creator: James

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
